meanings.definition: Sails set forward of the foremast of a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The headsails caught the wind and propelled the ship forward.
meanings.sent2: The sailors adjusted the headsails to catch the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The headsails danced in the wind, making the ship look like a graceful bird.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the headsails glowed golden against the darkening sky.
meanings.sent5: The headsails billowed like giant white clouds above the ship.

meanings.definition: The sails set on the head of a mast.
meanings.sent1: The crew hoisted the headsails to increase speed.
meanings.sent2: The headsails fluttered in the wind as the ship changed direction.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the headsails, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The headsails stood tall and proud, guiding the vessel through the waves.
meanings.sent5: The headsails whispered secrets to the ocean as they sailed by.
